author: mklement0
body:
<sup>Related: #5426</sup>

When background jobs are used to invoke an _external program_, it is important to have the ability to determine that program's exit code on job completion.

Currently, `[System.Management.Automation.PSRemotingJob]` doesn't reflect this information.

Desired behavior
-----------------

```powershell
$j = Start-Job { bash -c 'exit 1' }
Wait-Job $j
$j.LastExitCode  # -> 1 - WISHFUL THINKING
```

The **cumbersome workaround** is to make `$LASTEXITCODE` _part of the job's  output_, via an additional statement in the script block:

```powershell
$j = Start-Job { bash -c 'exit 1'; $LASTEXITCODE }
$output = $j | Receive-Job -Wait -AutoRemoveJob
$i = 0
$lastExitCodeFromJob, $actualOutput = $output.Where({ ++$i -eq $output.Count}, 'Split')
```


Environment data
----------------

```powershell
PowerShell Core v6.0.0-beta.9
```
title: System.Management.Automation.PSRemotingJob should reflect $LASTEXITCODE
